cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles SSW of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW, expected to turn northwest across central-western Cuba Monday and then track northward toward the Florida Straits and the west coast of the Florida Peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast (near the Tampa–Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for the Florida Peninsula at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Peninsula (both Gulf and Atlantic coasts) expected to experience rain, gusty winds, and rough surf early next week
weather_observation.wind: Low but increasing chance (≈10–15%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds with gusts 30–40 mph late Tuesday into early Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible, generally 1–2 ft along the Space Coast with onshore flow
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher totals could cause brief street/terminal flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the Atlantic beaches beginning Monday night
